reasoning: Left-sided (systolic) heart failure is a chronic condition, prevalence appropriate over incidence. Global prevalence estimated at ~15% of population (~15,000 per 100k) based on pooled epidemiological studies. Left-sided HF represents approximately 50-60% of all heart failure cases. Confidence reflects moderate source quality and geographic variation.
source: Mosterd A & Hoes AW. (2007). Clinical epidemiology of heart failure. Heart. 93(9):1137-1146
